intro: Symplocos neglecta, commonly known as the small-leaf sand cherry, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant features small, oval leaves that are typically less than 2 inches in length. Its flowers are white and clustered in dense inflorescences, blooming in early spring. The fruit is a small, red drupe that matures in the summer and is an important food source for birds and small mammals.
